results.title: Preparing and conducting an interview
results.creator_credit: Justin Shortal and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Finding out”.
Kylie’s class has been set the task of recording an interview with an aspect of their own choice. We follow Kylie’s progress as she moves through a process of preparing and conducting an interview.

results.title: Filmo 70DR with light meter
results.brief_description:
Leather custom case housing a 16mm Bell and Howell Company film camera, and a Weston Master Universal Exposure Meter with 2 accompanying booklets housed in their original cardboard storage box.

Medium/material description (removed from field for XOS data upgrade)
001: Pentagonal shapped leather fitted case and leather strap with a maroon-coloured velvet interior in good condition.
002: Heavy metal body and two lenses.
003 Plastic and metal.
004: Cardboard lid and base.
005: Paper instruction booklet.
006: Paper instruction booklet.
007: Paper

results.title: M.2-16mm 2T splicer
results.brief_description:
The splicer, afterwards simply know as the “Catozzo”, was born as a result of a serious form of allergy to the smell of the cement suffered by his inventor which produced the happy intuition to use adhesive tape in its place, for joining the various film ends together.
This idea was subsequently consolidated and patented all over the world, developing into all the various currently existing models. [SOURCE: https://www.cir-srl.com/ last accessed 20/06/2019]

CIR (Costruzione Incollatrici Rapide) Catozzo

Incollatrice M. 2-16mm 2T splicer
with adhesive tape
housed in original cardbox box.

Housed in storage box stamped three times with:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Included are: Instructions per film 16mm
description of splicers flier that folds out.
Made in Italy. Patented

Label at the bottom of the splicer has been attached which says:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Inscribed at the base: Made in Italy. US pat

silver label at the base reads:
made in Italy by
Officine Meccaniche
Dr. Leo Catozzo
00050 Santa Severa (Roma)
Tel. 0766/78008-78181

FPB A-2025

70mm cement splicer
Richard Brown donation

results.title: Economic Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Through the sequences in “Economic Australia” students have a rare opportunity to turn back the clock to witness filmmakers’ views of Australia’s economic development. The content focuses on some major events in the economic history of the nation as well as those everyday situations in which economics plays a part in our lives. Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Women in change
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A history of Australia’s women looking specifically at: the suffragette movement; the campaign for equal pay; women and unionism; abortion; contraception, sexual harassment; and politics.

results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Discusses the processes of film editing from the preparation of the work print to the completion of a finished, edited film. Explains the processes of setting up the editing bench, rewinding, using the moviescope, splicing, breaking-down the work print, marking, adding dialogue and using the moviola.
